links.title: Weekly Wrap: The Tale Of Two Cities Between Facebook And Amazon Earnings
links.description: This was the busiest week in earnings season thus far with 225 plus companies reporting. Beats are exceeding long-term averages, but those that beat are getting rewarded less than usual and those that missed are getting hit hard...just ask Facebook.

messages.body: #Apple earnings release on July 31. Double top leading into release. Some things to watch: https://trde.it/2vb6C4c $AAPL

links.title: Apple earnings: Most boring quarter of the year still holds some intrigue
links.description: Apple Inc. will report its most boring quarter of the year Tuesday, but there is still at least a little bit of drama. Spring is typically the least exciting period for Apple since many people who would be interested in buying an iPhones have either gotten one already or are holding out for the new lineup, typically released in late September.

Apple Reports Earnings on Tuesday: 5 Things to Watch $AAPL http://dlvr.it/Qd1QrT

links.title: Apple Reports Earnings on Tuesday: 5 Things to Watch
links.description: Apple Reports Earnings on Tuesday: 5 Things to Watch Though its shares have run up a bit over the past few months, Apple's forward earnings multiples are still fairly low, as are near-term investor expectations. That could work in the company's favor as it posts its June quarter earnings report after the close on Tuesday, July 31, and hosts an earnings call at 5 p.m.

messages.body: Earnings Season Shows Strong Revenue Momentum $AAPL $NFLX $FB https://goo.gl/oEHJyp

links.title: Earnings Season Shows Strong Revenue Momentum
links.description: The Q2 earnings season has sustained the positive momentum in place over the last few quarters. Overall growth is steadily moving towards the Q1 level, with all around positive surprises and plenty of momentum on the revenues side.

links.title: Trump administration working on consumer data privacy policy
links.description: The Trump administration is working to develop consumer data privacy policies, and the Commerce Department is meeting with big companies like Facebook Inc, Comcast Corp and Alphabet Inc as it looks to eventually seeing the policies enshrined in legislation, two officials said on Friday. Data privacy

links.title: Apple won't use Intel's 5G modem in future iPhones [u]
links.description: Intel will not be supplying Apple with radio chips in a future iPhone release, a report claims, with the chip producer said to have stopped development of parts that would have enabled 5G cellular communications on an upcoming version of Apple's smartphone.

links.title: 'WHAT THE F*CK IS GOING ON?' Linus Torvalds explodes at Intel spinning Spectre fix as a security feature
links.description: Intel's fix for Spectre variant 2 - the branch target injection design flaw affecting most of its processor chips - is not to fix it.
